page.title: 08THE WATER BAILIFF
page.content: { Mr Mark Simmonds}looks after Broadlands lake, keeping a watch on the level of water, the health of its inhabitants & the tidiness of its banks.To keep the number of fish at a satisfactory level, he said that many are now taken from the lake by using nets,to sell for restocking other lakes and to{' fish farmers'}who sell them later for table use. Access to the lake is controlled, resulting in a {"nature reserve type"}area. Many water birds make use of the area for breeding, amongst them,Coot,Moorhen, Tufted Duck ,Little Grebe & Great Crested Grebe. A large flock of Canada Geese,together with numerous sheep, graze the surrounding areas creating good conditions for many species of wild flowers, which in turn attract a host of butterflies and other insects.
